author: Special Correspondent
text:
Ahead of the Assembly polls in the State, IAS officer R. Kirlosh Kumar was appointed as Additional Chief Electoral Officer.

Mr. Kumar, who is at present the Director of Town and Country Planning, would join the Public (Elections) Department and assist Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Lakhoni.

The temporary post was created under IAS (Cadre) Rules, 1954, an order issued by Chief Secretary K. Gnanadesikan stated.

At present, besides Mr. Lakhoni, two IAS officers – Joint Chief Electoral Officers Ajay Yadav (Technical) and A. Sivagnanam (overseeing programmes such as Systematic Voters' Education and Electoral Participation are in the Public (Elections) Department.

“It is usual”

Commenting on the new appointment, a senior IAS officer said it was usual that an additional officer is appointed before the elections.
title: Kirlosh Kumar appointed Additional CEO
